text: Is there any way i can get the logo URL of the account in a custom module?
This gives me the domainname, not the URL of logo itself
basically default logo module will pull settings of your portal.

`company_domain` shoots back a complete string for the logo

```<IMG STYLE="BORDER:0;MARGIN:0;PADDING:0;DISPLAY:BLOCK;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;" SRC="<HTTPS://WWW.XYZ.COM/HUBFS/LOGO.SVG>" CLASS="HS-SITE-LOGO" >```
I just need the src in this case.

Hi guys,

I wonder if anyone could guide me on below.
I use `unixtimestamp( local_dt )` to get timestamp that I use to compare with `HubDB` record's enddate and display record accordingly on my webpage. Due to some requirement, I need to reload the page via `Javascript`. The page gets reload but `unixtimestamp( local_dt )` gives same timestamp value everytime, until I close the browser and reopen it. It should give new value on all page reload . Can anyone guide me in this matter?
Hey guys should this code work {% set rec_posts = blog_recent_posts(module.blog_field, 15, module.blog_tag) %} to allow the end user to select a blog and tag?

So is there any reason why the image resize function would be not resizing outside of a "this image is too big" scenario? The URL is being generated as I would expect... but it doesn't seem to be actually doing the resize.

`{{ resize_image_url(card.image.src, 0, 0, 500) }}`  <--- my snippet
Hm. Never mind. Think it is just a cache thing.
I'm assuming for already published assets, the resize takes a bit to kick in if it is added post-hoc?

Hey all,
I am attempting to concatenate a string with the contact. value to dynamically grab a contact property.
Here is an example of what I am attempting to do
```{% set lesson = "lesson_1_progress" %}
{{ contact.lesson }}```
I have also tried the following, but this just comes out as a string
```{{"contact."~"lesson_1_progress"}}```
Something I was pointed towards would be to use the <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/functions#crm-object|CRM Object HubL Function>. However, in my use case I would need to run this more than 10 times on any given page, so the CRM Object function would not work for me.
